fields.name: Political participation (How Was Life, OECD (2014))
fields.description: The share of the adult population who voted in previous elections.

fields.name: Political competition (How Was Life, OECD (2014))
fields.description: Political competition is one minus the share of the winning party's votes in a national election. It provides a measure of the winning party's dominance in the election.

fields.name: Index of Democracy (How Was Life, OECD (2014))
fields.description:
The Index of Democracy, by Vanhanen, is the product of the participation and the competition indices, divided by 100. Specifically: Index = [(% of the adult population who voted in the elections) * (1 - % of the winning party's votes in a national election)] / 100

Its value is between 0 and 100, with 100 being the maximum theoretically possible level of democracy.

fields.name: Polity2 (How Was Life, OECD (2014))
fields.description: Polity2 is an aggregate measure of the political regimes on a -10 (fully authoritarian) to +10 (fully democratic) scale.
